revisions.rev:
{{About|the suburb|the former [[territorial authority]]|Manukau City|}} {{Infobox New Zealand suburbs | name = Manukau | image = | caption1 = | city1 = [[Auckland Council]] | city2 = | ward = Manukau | board = Otara-Papatoetoe
Manurewa-Papakura | sub_board = Papatoetoe
Manurewa | established = | area = | population = | popdate = | trainstations = | ferryterminals = | airports = | hospitals = | north = [[Papatoetoe]] | northeast = [[Clover Park]] | east = [[Goodwood Heights]] | southeast = [[Totara Heights]] | south = [[Manurewa]] | southwest = [[Wiri]] | west = [[Puhinui]] | northwest = [[Papatoetoe]] | map = | caption2 = }} '''Manukau''' is an industrial suburb of the city of [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]. The suburb is located 23 kilometres south of [[Auckland CBD]], and is in the Manukau ward, one of the thirteen electoral divisions of the [[Auckland Council]]. The name ''Manukau'', from the [[Manukau Harbour]] west of the city, is of [[MÄori language|MÄori]] origin, and means 'wading birds',{{Citation needed|date=October 2008}} although it has been suggested that the name of the harbour was also sometimes rendered as ''MÄnuka'', meaning a marker post with which an early chief is said to have claimed the area.[http://www.teara.govt.nz/Places/Auckland/AucklandPlaces/16/en Manukau - Naming the harbour] (from [[Te Ara Encyclopedia of New Zealand]]. Accessed 2008-06-22.) Manukau was governed by the [[Manukau City|Manukau City Council]] until November 2010, when the entire Auckland region was amalgamated into a single Auckland city. The area still has a strong economic central business district, but is no longer an independent city. The area is now governed by the Auckland Council. The area immediately to the south of the [[Otahuhu, New Zealand|Otahuhu]] isthmus, as far east as [[Maraetai]] and [[Kawakawa Bay]] including [[Howick, New Zealand|Howick]] and [[Clevedon]], and as far south as [[Manurewa]], was previously known as [[Manukau City]], however it should not be confused with the suburb of Manukau. All former suburbs of Manukau City are now governed by the Auckland Council. == References == {{Reflist}} {{coord|36|59|S|174|53|E|region:NZ_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Main urban areas in New Zealand]] [[Category:Suburbs of Auckland]]
